definitions.definition: A person or group of people constituting one side in a legal proceeding, such as in a legal action or a contract .
examples: The contract requires that the party of the first part pay the fee.

subdefinitions.definition: With to : someone who takes part in an action or affair ; an accessory .
examples: I can't possibly be a party to that kind of reckless behaviour.

definitions.definition: A group of people forming one side in a given dispute , contest , etc., or united in maintaining a cause , policy , or opinion in opposition to others; a faction .

subdefinitions.definition: Active player characters organized into a single group.
A group of characters controlled by the player .

A political group considered as a formal whole, usually organized on a national basis, which contests elections and aims to form or take part in a government ; a political party . [from 1680s] ( with the and capital initial ) The Communist Party , especially as the sole political party of a communist state. [from 1919] ( dated , now rare ) The feeling of solidarity with and support for one's political party ; partisanship , especially in political matters.
examples: The green party took 12% of the vote.

definitions.definition: A detachment of troops selected for a particular service or duty .
examples: The settlers were attacked early next morning by a scouting party .

definitions.definition: A group of people gathered together, especially temporarily, for a specific purpose such as travel or sport .
examples: We're expecting a large party from the London office.
Do you have a table available for a party of four?

subdefinitions.definition: A social gathering , usually of invited guests , which typically involves eating , drinking , and entertainment and often held to celebrate a particular occasion.
examples: I'm throwing a huge party for my 21st birthday.

subdefinitions.definition: A gathering of acquaintances so that one of them may offer items for sale to the rest of them.

definitions.definition: A small group of birds or mammals .
A prospective partner or an offer of marriage.

main_definition: ( law ) A person or group of people constituting one side in a legal proceeding, such as in a legal action or a contract . [from ca. 1300s]
secondary_definitions: ( dated , slang , vulgar or humorous ) A person ; an individual . [from after 1475]

( now rare in general sense ) A group of people forming one side in a given dispute , contest , etc., or united in maintaining a cause , policy , or opinion in opposition to others; a faction . [from ca. 1320s]
( military ) A detachment of troops selected for a particular service or duty . [from ca. 1330]
A group of people gathered together, especially temporarily, for a specific purpose such as travel or sport . [from after 1387]
A small group of birds or mammals . [from after 1387]
( obsolete ) A prospective partner or an offer of marriage. [1492–1854]
